required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ovicidal Efficacy and Safety of Abametapir Lotion 0.74% Administered for the Treatment of Head Lice Infestation
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised, Double-Blind, Vehicle-Controlled Study of Ovicidal Efficacy and Safety of Abametapir 0.74% Administered for the Treatment of Head Lice Infestation

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study was to evaluate ovicidal efficacy of a single application of abametapir lotion 0.74% w/w intended for the treatment of head lice.

detailed_description.textblock: This was a double-blind, randomised, vehicle-controlled, parallel group study in males and females, aged three years and older with active head lice infestation. The study was designed to assess the ovicidal efficacy of a single application of abametapir lotion 0.74% w/w compared to a vehicle control, when applied to the scalp and hair for 10 minutes at the study site. This study used an ex vivo method of assessment for ovicidal efficacy.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Hatched Eggs Pre Treatment Relative to Post Treatment
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of hatched eggs pre treatment relative to percentage of hatched eggs post treatment for the abametapir and vehicle treated eggs following 14 day incubation. The difference between post treatment percent hatching and pre-treatment percent hatching was calculated i.e. post-treatment minus pre-treatment hatching percent.

arm_group.description: Topically administered to hair and scalp for 10 minutes application.
Administered to scalp and hair for 10 minutes application.

intervention.description: 200mL abametapir lotion topically administered to the scalp and hair and once fully saturated left for 10 minutes and then washed out thoroughly with warm water.
control to abametapir: 200mL Vehicle Lotion topically administered to the scalp and hair and once fully saturated left for 10 minutes and then washed out thoroughly with warm water.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Healthy male or female based on medical history
2. Six months of age or older.
3. Has an active head lice infestation with a minimum of 3 live head lice and at least 10 undamaged and unhatched head lice eggs in their hair.
4. Agrees to an examination for head lice and compliance with the study procedures.
5. All adult subjects must sign a written voluntary informed consent. For minors, the parent/ legal guardian agrees to the subject participating in the study as determined by the signing of an assent of informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Has scalp disease or a history of allergies or prior reactions to any head lice products.
2. Has a condition that, in the opinion of the Investigator, may interfere with the study.
3. Is receiving systemic or topical medication, which in the opinion of the Investigator, may compromise the integrity of the safety and/or efficacy assessments.
4. Had treatment (over-the-counter (OTC) or home remedy medication) for head lice within 14 days prior to Day 0.
5. Has received an investigational agent within 30 days prior to Day 0.

overall_official.affiliation: National Head Lice Treatment Centre, Ringwood East, Victoria, Australia, 3135

group.title: Abametapir Lotion 0.74% w/w
group.description: Topically administered to hair and scalp for 10 minutes application. Abametapir Lotion 0.74% w/w: 200mL abametapir lotion topically administered to the scalp and hair and once fully saturated left for 10 minutes and then washed out thoroughly with warm water.

group.description: Administered to scalp and hair for 10 minutes application. Vehicle Lotion: control to abametapir: 200mL Vehicle Lotion topically administered to the scalp and hair and once fully saturated left for 10 minutes and then washed out thoroughly with warm water.

baseline.population: All Randomized Population included subjects who were randomized into the study.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Percentage of Hatched Eggs Pre Treatment Relative to Post Treatment
outcome.description: Percentage of hatched eggs pre treatment relative to percentage of hatched eggs post treatment for the abametapir and vehicle treated eggs following 14 day incubation. The difference between post treatment percent hatching and pre-treatment percent hatching was calculated i.e. post-treatment minus pre-treatment hatching percent.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS) included all randomized subjects who received any amount of study treatment and had at least 1 viable pre-treatment egg and 1 viable post-treatment egg evaluable for analysis.

The difference between post treatment percent hatching and pre-treatment percent hatching was calculated i.e. post-treatment minus pre-treatment hatching percent.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS) included all randomized subjects who received any amount of study treatment and had at least 1 viable pre-treatment egg and 1 viable post-treatment egg evaluable for analysis.
measure.units: Percent hatched eggs post versus pre Rx

reported_events.time_frame: AEs were collected from the start of treatment on Day 0 through the Day 7 follow up visit (Approximately 8 days).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
